DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: NASCIMENTO, Anderson C. A.;Nascimento, Anderson;Nascimento, A.;NASCIMENTO, ANDERSON C.A.;NASCIMENTO, A. C. A.;ALVES NASCIMENTO, ANDERSON CLAYTON;CLAYTON ALVES NASCIMENTO, ANDERSON;Anderson C. A. Nascimento;Anderson Clayton Alves Nascimento;Anderson C A Nascimento;Nascimento, Anderson C A;Nascimento, ACA

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Possui graduação em Engenharia Elétrica pela Universidade de Brasília (1998), mestrado em Information And Communication Engineering - University Of Tokyo (2001) e doutorado em Information And Communication Engineering - University Of Tokyo (2004). Atualmente é professor assistente da Universidade de Washington e membro do programa de pós-graduação em engenharia elétrica da Universidade de Brasília. Tem experiência nas áreas de Engenharia Elétrica e Ciência da Computação, com ênfase em Segurança da Informação e Criptografia. O prof. Nascimento publicou algumas dezenas de artigos em conferências e periódicos científicos de alto prestígio e é detentor de uma patente internacional. O prof. Nascimento é revisor ad-hoc da FINEP, CNPq, CAPES e da FAPDF e já prestou consultoria e desenvolveu projetos científicos com diversas empresas como SAGEM-ORGA, Dell Computers, Nortel Networks, Q-Free, Intel, NIARA, etc. Alguns dos produtos co-desenvolvidos pelo professor Nascimento, no ramo de segurança bancária, possuem uma base de centenas de milhares de usuários. O professor Nascimento foi consultor da Agência Brasileira de Inteligência, foi o coordenador da comissão especial de segurança da informação da sociedade brasileira de computação (SBC), foi cordenador do comitê de programa do IX Simpósio Brasileiro de Segurança da Informação e de Sistemas Computacionais, foi o coordenador geral da XI edição do mesmo evento. Por fim, o professor Nascimento e membro do corpo editorial do IET Information Security Journal e sera o coordenador geral e coordenador do comitê de programa do evento ICITS (International conference on Information Theoretical Security) em 2016, no estado de Washington, EUA.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: graduate at Engenharia Elétrica from Universidade de Brasília (1998), master's at Information And Communication Engineering from University Of Tokyo (2001) and ph.d. at Information And Communication Engineering from University Of Tokyo (2004). Has experience in Electric Engineering

A.;ALVES NASCIMENTO, ANDERSON CLAYTON;CLAYTON ALVES NASCIMENTO, ANDERSON;Anderson C. A. Nascimento;Anderson Clayton Alves Nascimento;Anderson C A Nascimento;Nascimento, Anderson C A;Nascimento, ACA

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To reduce management burdens without reducing the safety of designated confirmer signatures even when a plurality of designated confirmer signatures are created. ; SOLUTION: The designated confirmer signature creating device 10 stores a common value among the plurality of designated confirmer signatures and independent values of the individual designated confirmer signatures in a storage portion 11. The common value needs be stored in safety, but the independent values may be open to the public. The designated confirmer signature creating device 10 creates a designated confirmer signature by using a value for which a one-directional function has been applied for a bit coupling value between the common value and independent values. When the designated confirmer signature creating device 10 proves to a third party device that the designated confirmer signature has been created by the designated confirmer signature creating device 10, it shows the common value and independent values to the third party device.; The third party device judges whether or not the creator of the designated confirmer signature is an authorized one by using a value for which a one-way function has been applied for a bit coupling value between the common value and independent values.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To reduce management burdens without reducing the safety of designated confirmer signatures even when a plurality of designated confirmer signatures are created. ; SOLUTION: The designated confirmer signature creating device 10 stores a common value among the plurality of designated confirmer signatures and independent values of the individual designated confirmer signatures in a storage portion 11. The common value needs be stored in safety, but the independent values may be open to the public. The designated confirmer signature creating device 10 creates a designated confirmer signature by using a value for which a one-directional function has been applied for a bit coupling value between the common value and independent values. When the designated confirmer signature creating device 10 proves to a third party device that the designated confirmer signature has been created by the designated confirmer signature creating device 10, it shows the common value and independent values to the third party device.; The third party device judges whether or not the creator of the designated confirmer signature is an authorized one by using a value for which a one-way function has been applied for a bit coupling value between the common value and independent values.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To reduce management burdens without reducing the safety of designated confirmer signatures even when a plurality of designated confirmer signatures are created. ; SOLUTION: The designated confirmer signature creating device 10 stores a common value among the plurality of designated confirmer signatures and independent values of the individual designated confirmer signatures in a storage portion 11. The common value needs be stored in safety, but the independent values may be open to the public. The designated confirmer signature creating device 10 creates a designated confirmer signature by using a value for which a one-directional function has been applied for a bit coupling value between the common value and independent values. When the designated confirmer signature creating device 10 proves to a third party device that the designated confirmer signature has been created by the designated confirmer signature creating device 10, it shows the common value and independent values to the third party device.; The third party device judges whether or not the creator of the designated confirmer signature is an authorized one by using a value for which a one-way function has been applied for a bit coupling value between the common value and independent values.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To reduce management burdens without reducing the safety of designated confirmer signatures even when a plurality of designated confirmer signatures are created. ; SOLUTION: The designated confirmer signature creating device 10 stores a common value among the plurality of designated confirmer signatures and independent values of the individual designated confirmer signatures in a storage portion 11. The common value needs be stored in safety, but the independent values may be open to the public. The designated confirmer signature creating device 10 creates a designated confirmer signature by using a value for which a one-directional function has been applied for a bit coupling value between the common value and independent values. When the designated confirmer signature creating device 10 proves to a third party device that the designated confirmer signature has been created by the designated confirmer signature creating device 10, it shows the common value and independent values to the third party device.; The third party device judges whether or not the creator of the designated confirmer signature is an authorized one by using a value for which a one-way function has been applied for a bit coupling value between the common value and independent values.
